intro: Gynoxys jamesonii, commonly known as the Jameson's gynoxys, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
